basics.name: WiseZenn
basics.label: Graduate Student
basics.summary: A mechanical engineering graduate student at Southern University of Science and Technology, passionate about robotics, control systems, and intelligent manufacturing.

work.name: Design and Fabrication of a Bionic Butterfly
work.summary: Led the structural design of a biomimetic flapper using SolidWorks; engineered a dual-servo direct drive mechanism.
highlights: Conducted aerodynamic simulations using Xflow to analyze lift/drag characteristics and optimized the wing topology.
Implemented the flight control system, achieving stable flight and rapid response to external disturbances.
Outcome: 2nd Prize, Chang'an University Mechanical Innovation Design Competition.

work.name: Arduino-based Magnetically Constrained Balancing Device
work.summary: Designed a magnetic levitation system using Arduino and electromagnetic coils to achieve non-contact constraint.
highlights: Developed and tuned PID algorithms to enhance system stability and suppress vibrations under external impact.
Managed the prototyping process, significantly improving structural rigidity and interference immunity.
Outcome: 1st Prize, National College Physics Experiment Competition (Innovation); 2nd Prize in the Northwest Regional Physics Experiment Competition.

work.name: Design and Fabrication of a Bionic Butterfly
work.summary: Addressed the low rock-breaking efficiency bottleneck by developing a pressure-impulse coupling mechanism.
highlights: Modeled the complex cutterhead assembly (>500 parts) in SolidWorks and analyzed cutter-rock interaction mechanics.
Optimized the layout of hob-hammer units to maximize the static-kinetic coupling effect for hard rock geology.
Outcome: Grand Prize, 13th Challenge Cup (Shaanxi Region); Authorized 2 Utility Model Patents; National Innovation Project Excellence Award.

education.institution: Southern University of Science and Technology
highlights: Focus on robotics and intelligent manufacturing systems
Rank: 3/119 (Top 3%)
Awards: National Scholarship (2022, 2023, 2024 - Top 1% of the department)
Key Coursework: Microcontroller Principles (94), Computational Methods (97), Dynamics of Mechanical Systems (92), Mechanics of Materials (94), Theoretical Mechanics (90)

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

publications.name: Zur Elektrodynamik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
highlights: Quantum Teleportation
Quantum Cryptography
